metadata.title: CVE-2022-31003 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Sofia-SIP is an open-source Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) User-Agentlibrary. Prior to version 1.13.8, when parsing each line of a sdp message,`rest = record + 2` will access the memory behind `\0` and cause anout-of-bounds write. An attacker can send a message with evil sdp toFreeSWITCH, causing a crash or more serious consequence, such as remotecode execution. Version 1.13.8 contains a patch for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31003` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsofia-sip-ua-glib3 - 1.12.11+20110422.1-2.1+deb10u3ubuntu0.20.04.1
libsofia-sip-ua0 - 1.12.11+20110422.1-2.1+deb10u3ubuntu0.20.04.1
sofia-sip-bin - 1.12.11+20110422.1-2.1+deb10u3ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sofia-sip package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.11+20110422.1-2.1+deb10u3ubuntu0.20.04.1').
